title: Surfing
short_description: Catch waves at India's emerging surf spots along the east and west coasts.
long_description:
Surfing is exploding in India, transforming quiet fishing villages into vibrant surf towns. With over 7,000 km of coastline, the subcontinent offers fantastic waves for beginners and intermediates, with a few world-class reef breaks for experts.

Mulki (Karnataka), Mahabalipuram (Tamil Nadu), and Varkala (Kerala) are the epicenters of this culture. Surf schools here are run by ISA (International Surfing Association) certified instructors who emphasize safety and ocean awareness. The vibe is laid-back: wake up early, catch the morning swell, eat healthy, do yoga, and repeat.

Unlike the massive, intimidating waves of Hawaii, Indian waves are generally mellower (3-5 feet), making it one of the best places in the world to learn the sport. The warm water means you can often surf in boardshorts without a wetsuit.

locations.summary: Home to the Mantra Surf Club, India's first surf school. Mellow, clean waves perfect for learning.
Surf beneath dramatic red cliffs. Good sand breaks for beginners.
Right-hand point breaks near the Shore Temple. Vibrant surf community.
Famous for the Covelong Point Surf Festival and consistent waves.
Surf schools operate seasonally; fun, small waves for total novices.

opening_hours.time_notes: Lessons are tide-dependent. Morning sessions (6-9 AM) usually have the best wind conditions.

operating_season.off_season: Monsoon (June–August) - waves can be huge and messy, only for experts.
operating_season.season_notes: East coast (Tamil Nadu) gets good pre-monsoon swell in June-July.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Packages often include accommodation + surf lessons.

safety_guidelines: Always surf with a buddy or instructor.
Cover your head when falling to protect from your own board.
Respect the locals and 'right of way' on waves.
Be aware of rip currents (currents pulling out to sea).
Use a leash (leg rope) at all times.
equipment_checklist: Rash guard or t-shirt (to prevent wax rash)
major_experiences: The indescribable feeling of standing up on a wave
Understanding the rhythm of the ocean
Coffee and community breakfast after morning surf

sample_itinerary.one_day: 7:00 AM: Arrival at Surf School. Briefing on land (pop-up technique). 7:30 AM: Enter water. Instructor pushes you into waves. Practice riding whitewater. 9:00 AM: Debrief and breakfast.

booking_methods: Online via surf school websites (Mantra, Soul & Surf, Kallialay)
booking_details.suggested_stay: Mulki: Ashram Surf Retreat. Varkala: Soul & Surf. Mahabalipuram: Surf Turf.
booking_details.how_to_reach: Mulki is 30km from Mangalore airport. Mahabalipuram is 1 hr from Chennai.

seo.seo_description: Learn to surf in India. Top surf schools in Mulki, Varkala, and Kovalam. Surf camp prices, best season, and beginner tips.

highlights: India has warm water - no wetsuits needed!
Waves are beginner-friendly and less crowded than Bali/Sri Lanka.
Strong community vibe in surf towns like Mulki and Mahabs.
Affordable lessons compared to international standards.
Combine surfing with yoga and coastal cuisine.
Chance to sport dolphins while waiting in the lineup.
